alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 9:16PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, Pike, southwestern Garland, southeastern Montgomery and southwestern Hot Spring Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 914 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Amity to 6 miles northeast of Daisy to near Corinth. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Murfreesboro... Glenwood... Gurdon... Amity... Caddo Valley... Norman... Okolona... Daisy... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... Daisy State Park... Crater Of Diamonds State Park... Narrows Dam... DeGray Lake State Park... Halfway... Richwoods... Donaldson... Delight... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, western and southwestern Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations
